About Mikhail

Master of Pravilo, wellness practitioner, and adventurer

My Journey

My path began with a deep interest in the body and health. I studied at a sports college, then at a physical education university in Moscow. But the most important lessons I received were not from books, but from living experience—through travel, exploration, and personal experiments with body and consciousness.

From a young age, I was drawn to freedom and exploring the limits of human potential. I spent many years hitchhiking across Russia and post-Soviet countries, traveling almost the entire southern coast of the country. Then I went further—to Asia. I visited Thailand, Malaysia, Indonesia, Cambodia, Vietnam. I lived for a long time in India and South Korea. These travels taught me lightness, the ability to adapt, and to see beauty in simplicity.

Mikhail's Journey

My Practices

Massage Therapy

I work as a massage master—relieving spasms, working on trigger points, restoring body mobility. I have an individual approach: sometimes gentle, sometimes deep, but always with attention to the person.

Alpha Gravity System

I teach the Alpha Gravity system and create Pravilo simulators that help develop strength, flexibility, and ligament health.

Cold Therapy

I practice hardening—I walk in shorts and t-shirt all year round, even in winter. This practice strengthens the immune system and builds mental resilience.

Breathing & Spiritual Practices

I use breathing techniques, prayers, and internal gratitude practices. I believe that health begins not only with the body but also with the soul, with inner connection to God and the universe.

Nutrition Experiments

Nutrition became a real laboratory for me. I tried different systems: vegetarianism, veganism, raw foodism. In the end, I was on raw food for eight years, of which three and a half years were pure fruitarianism. Later I added softer regimes. These years showed me how nutrition affects the body and psyche, energy levels, and clarity of consciousness.

I practiced long-term fasting, did cleanses, including with castor oil, drank fresh juices. All this was part of a big experiment in self-recovery. I realized that the body can renew itself and launch its regenerative processes if given the right conditions.

What I Learned

  • How nutrition affects energy and consciousness
  • The body's ability to regenerate and heal
  • Different approaches to cleansing and detoxification
  • The connection between food and spiritual practice

Beyond Body Work

Music

I'm a musician, I play the jaw harp and harmonica. Music for me is a way to connect with myself and people. I create unique sounds that resonate with the soul.

Handicrafts

I create jewelry from wire and crystals. For me, this is a meditative process in which unique things are born. Each piece carries energy and intention.

Travel

Travel continues to be part of me. I believe that the world is our greatest teacher, and every journey brings new insights and growth.

My Philosophy

I've experienced many challenges and losses. There were difficult periods—loss of home, business, family. At some point, I found myself in survival mode. But it was this that made me deeper. I learned to perceive events as facts, not just as emotions. I understood that emotions are energy: they can nourish us or destroy us. It all depends on quality and direction.

My philosophy of relationships, for example, is built on trust and sincerity. I see them as a common "well of energy" from which two people can draw if they take care of it together.

Core Principles

  • Trust and Sincerity: The foundation of all relationships
  • Energy Awareness: Understanding emotions as energy
  • Continuous Growth: Never stopping the search for improvement
  • Nature Connection: Learning from the natural world

Ready to Begin Your Journey?

Let me guide you on your path to health, freedom, and harmony. Together, we'll explore the ancient power of Pravilo and discover your potential.
